intro: Pseudopodospermum molle, commonly known as the soft podded milk tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its soft, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its latex sap is milky and can be used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil.
